revised_title: Weak Interactions of Muon: CERN Experiments and Theoretical Predictions
tldr: This article discusses the weak interactions of the muon and their similarities to those of the electron. The author examines the current experimental data and theoretical predictions, focusing on the role of neutrinos and the possibility of a massive intermediate vector boson. The article also explores the muon-proton capture interaction and its implications for the understanding of weak interactions.
